thread.title: Monday's area roundup: Fenwick girls, Beverly boys remain unbeaten
thread.title_full: Monday's area roundup: Fenwick girls, Beverly boys remain unbeaten

title: Monday's area roundup: Fenwick girls, Beverly boys remain unbeaten
text:
MIKE SPRINGER/Staff photo Monday's area roundup: Fenwick girls, Beverly boys remain unbeaten 
MIKE SPRINGER/Staff photoAidan Hammond of the Ipswich High golf team studys the putting green Monday during the Old Cape Ann Classic Golf Tournament in Rockport. MIKE SPRINGER/Staff photo Monday's area roundup: Fenwick girls, Beverly boys remain unbeaten 
MIKE SPRINGER/Staff photo Jack Maino of Ipswich tees off Monday during the Old Cape Ann Classic Golf Tournament in Rockport. Posted: Monday, October 12, 2015 10:38 pm Monday's area roundup: Fenwick girls, Beverly boys remain unbeaten 
GIRLS SOCCER 
Bishop Fenwick 3, Newburyport 1: Danielle Deltorto scored twice and Sydney Brennan had one goal to power the Crusaders to victory. Colleen Corcoran and Abbey Rocker each had assists for Fenwick (8-0-1), which got eight saves from goalie Merry Harrington. 
BOYS SOCCER 
Beverly 7, Ipswich 1: Leo Feingold had a pair of goals while Brendan Chan also scored in his first game of the season back from injury as Beverly (8-0-2) stayed undefeated with this win over the weekend. John Loreti, Luke Samperi and Sean Hanlon also tallied for the Panthers, whose other score came off an own goal by Ipswich. 
FIELD HOCKEY 
Bishop Fenwick 1, Medfield 1: Junior Stefanie Libby had the lone goal for the Crusaders (3-8-1) to give the hosts a 1-0 lead 15 minutes into the game before Medfield tied it in the second half. Maggie O’Connor and Lauren Hallice both played well for Fenwick (3-8-1). 
GOLF 
Ipswich splits at Old CAL Classic: The Tigers defeated Rockport, 116-100, but lost to Manchester Essex, 117-116, at the Old Cape Ann League Classic. Ipswich’s Jack Maino was the match’s medalist with 28 points. Aidan Hammond (23 points) and Tyler Starr (21) also played well for Ipswich (5-7), which needs to win its final two matches to qualify for the postseason. 
Salem 37, Winthrop 35: The Witches qualified for the postseason with this victory. Tommy Harrington (5-4), Cam Twomey ( 5 1/2-3 1/2), John Ballou (6 1/2-2 1/2), and Wes Schaejbe (5-4) had the wins for Salem, which improved to 9-5-1. The Witches have three more matches remaining, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday. 
COLLEGE FIELD HOCKEY 
ST. JOSEPH’S 1, GORDON 1 (2 OT): The Plaid (now 5-9) saw their three-game winning streak halted despite 15 saves in goal from Shannon Hicks. Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
